meanings.definition: A stay supporting the foremast of a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: The forestay kept the foremast steady in the strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The sailors secured the forestay to ensure the foremast's stability.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the forestay, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: Like a loyal friend, the forestay held the foremast upright through rough seas.
meanings.sent5: The forestay, like a guardian angel, protected the foremast from swaying dangerously.

meanings.definition: A cable or rope supporting the mast of a sailboat from the bow.
meanings.sent1: The forestay helped keep the mast in place while sailing.
meanings.sent2: Sailors always check the forestay before setting out to sea.
meanings.sent3: The forestay played tug-of-war with the mast, trying to pull it closer.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of the waves, the forestay embraced the mast securely.
meanings.sent5: The forestay whispered to the mast, 'I'll always be here to hold you up.'
